texts.value: Transfers sialic acid from CMP-sialic acid to galactose-containing acceptor substrates. In B lymphocytes, generates neuraminidase-sensitive lymphocyte cell-surface differentiation antigens, such as CDw75, HB-6 and CD76 (PubMed:1730763)

reaction.name: a beta-D-galactoside + CMP-N-acetyl-beta-neuraminate = an N-acetyl-alpha-neuraminyl-(2->6)-beta-D-galactosyl derivative + CMP + H(+)

texts.value: Membrane-bound form in trans cisternae of Golgi (PubMed:20378551). Secreted into the body fluid (By similarity)

ST6GAL1 has been mistakenly referred to as B-cell antigen CD75 or CDw75 but CD75 is a carbohydrate epitope on glycoproteins or glycolipids product of ST6GAL1 enzymatic activity (PubMed:1730763, PubMed:2373995). ST6GAL1 generates CD75 by catalyzing the addition of sialic acid in alpha2,6 linkage to galactose residues (PubMed:1547499, PubMed:1730763, PubMed:35789385)

features.description: Helical; Signal-anchor for type II membrane protein
No effect on dimerization and on location at the Golgi stack.

citation.title: Complete cDNA sequence encoding human beta-galactoside alpha-2,6-sialyltransferase.
The B cell antigen CD75 is a cell surface sialyltransferase.
The HB-6, CDw75, and CD76 differentiation antigens are unique cell-surface carbohydrate determinants generated by the beta-galactoside alpha 2,6-sialyltransferase.

The DNA sequence, annotation and analysis of human chromosome 3.
The status, quality, and expansion of the NIH full-length cDNA project: the Mammalian Gene Collection (MGC).
Isolation and characterization of a partial cDNA for a human sialyltransferase.
The B lymphocyte surface antigen CD75 is not an alpha-2,6-sialyltransferase but is a carbohydrate antigen, the production of which requires the enzyme.
Glycoproteomics analysis of human liver tissue by combination of multiple enzyme digestion and hydrazide chemistry.
